data.Sentence_cn: 哈勃望远镜于1990年4月20日由国家航空航天局发射升空，耗资10多亿美元。
data.Sentence: The Hubble telescope was launched into space by NASA on April 20,1990 at a cost of over a billion dollars.

data.Sentence_cn: 从最开始哈勃望远镜就有问题。
data.Sentence: Right from the start there was trouble with the Hubble.

data.Sentence_cn: 它传送给我们的图像很令人失望，因为它的主要镜子有误差。
data.Sentence: The pictures it sent us were very disappointing because its main mirror was faulty!

data.Sentence_cn: 国家航天局准备纠正这一错误，为此将把4名宇航员送入太空修复望远镜。
data.Sentence: NASA is now going to put the telescope right, so it will soon be sending up four astronauts to repair it.

data.Sentence_cn: “奋进”号航天飞机将把宇航员送上哈勃。
data.Sentence: The shuttle Endeavour will be taking the astronauts to the Hubble.

data.Sentence_cn: 当宇航员进行必要的修复工作时，“奋进”号上的一只机器手将抓住望远镜并托住它。
data.Sentence: A robot-arm from the Endeavour will grab the telescope and hold it while the astronauts make the necessary repairs.

data.Sentence_cn: 当然，哈勃位于地球的大气层之外，
data.Sentence: Of course, the Hubble is above the earth's atmosphere,

data.Sentence_cn: 因此，它很快就会给我们传送我们所见到过的、有关行星和远距离星系的最清晰的照片。
data.Sentence: so it will soon be sending us the clearest pictures of the stars and distant galaxies that we have ever seen.

data.Sentence_cn: 哈勃将告诉我们有关宇宙的年龄和大小的许多事情。
data.Sentence: The Hubble will tell us a great deal about the age and size of the universe.

data.Sentence_cn: 等到你读到这篇文章时，敏锐的哈勃望远镜已经为我们送来了成千上万张精彩的照片。
data.Sentence: By the time you read this, the Hubble's eagle eye will have sent us thousands and thousands of wonderful pictures.
